Timeline Event Description: An initial case of illness in humans is identified by local public health and medical professionals, but the cause of illness is not yet known, as the agent has not been identified.

The cause of the illness in both human and animal populations is identified. If the agent is a World Health Organization notifiable agent, it is mandated that the affected State alerts the World Health Organization about the outbreak.
A serious and credible threat of deliberate use is identified, but has not yet been confirmed.

The impacted State makes a series of requests to the appropriate authorities for assistance, which may include deployment of personnel or financial assistance. Requests may also be made by other member States of international organizations.
The World Health Organization declares a public health emergency.

Timeline Event: Case in animals identified by veterinary professionals
Timeline Event Description: An initial case of illness in animal populations is identified by local public health and veterinary professionals, but the cause of illness is not yet known, as the agent has not yet been identified.
Based the results of epidemiological and criminal investigations, the event is confirmed to be the result of a deliberate release of biological agents.
The national and international community respond to the ongoing outbreak. At this point in the event timeline, refugees may begin to flee the country, or may continue to do so.
